page.title: 11Rhyl: Tourism
page.content: Rhyl as a town relies heavily on holidaymakers as a source of income. The holidaymakers come mostly from Liverpool, Manchester and Birmingham but also from all over the county. They begin to arrive around the beginning of April right through until mid- September. Sometimes there are elderly couples who come in the winter for some peace and quiet. Apart from the tourist industry Rhyls population relies heavily on jobs in the towns shops, offices, Glan Clwyd Hospital Bodelwyddan, and many small local industries such as Pilkintons at St. Asaph. The tourist industry provides such jobs as shop assistants, arcade workers, hotel workers,waiters and waitresses. Many of these jobs are seasonal.
